com.novell.ldapchai.util
Class SearchHelper

java.lang.Object
  com.novell.ldapchai.util.SearchHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable
public class SearchHelper
extends Object
implements Serializable, Cloneable

SearchHelper is a mutable helper class for managing LDAP search queries.

Author:
Jason D. Rivard
See Also:

Constructor Detail

SearchHelper

public SearchHelper()
Construct a default SearchHelper with default values for all parameters.

SearchHelper

public SearchHelper(String filter)
Construct a SearchHelper with the supplied parameters. Default values are used for missing values.

Parameters:
filter - A valid ldap search filter. null will set the filter to DEFAULT_FILTER.

SearchHelper

public SearchHelper(ChaiProvider.SEARCH_SCOPE searchScope)
Construct a SearchHelper with the supplied parameters. Default values are used for missing values.

Parameters:
searchScope - A valid SEARCH_SCOPE of Base, One or Subtree

Parameters:

getAttributes

public Set<String> getAttributes()
Get the list of attributes that will be returned during a search. Note that some places that SearchHelper is used don't return attribute values at all, so this setting is discounted.

Returns:
A list of valid attribute names

setAttributes

public void setAttributes(String... attributes)
Set the filter to a list of attributes.

Parameters:
attributes - A list of attribute names.

getFilter

public String getFilter()
Current LDAP search filter

Returns:
String representation of filter in RFC2254 format.

clearFilter

setFilterAnd

public void setFilterAnd(Map<String,String> nameValuePairs)
Set up an AND filter for each map key and value. Consider the following example.

Example Values

AttributeValue
givenNameJohn
snSmith

Result

(&(givenName=John)(sn=Smith))

Parameters:
nameValuePairs - A valid list of attribute to name pairs

setFilterAnd

public void setFilterAnd(Properties nameValuePairs)
Convienence wrapper for setFilterAnd(java.util.Map)

Parameters:
nameValuePairs - A valid map of name=value pairs.
See Also:
setFilterAnd(java.util.Map)

setFilterExists

public void setFilterExists(String attributeName)
Set up an exists filter for attribute name. Consider the following example.

Example Values

Value
givenName

Result

(givenName=*)

Parameters:
attributeName - A valid attribute name

setFilterExists

public void setFilterExists(Set<String> attributeNames)
Set up an exists filter for attribute name. Consider the following example.

Example Values

Value
givenName
sn

Result

(&(givenName=*)(sn=*))

Parameters:
attributeNames - A valid set of attribute names

setFilterNot

public void setFilterNot(String attributeName,
                         String value)
Set up a not exists filter for an attribute name and value pair.

Example Values

AttributeValue
givenNameJohn

Result

(!(givenName=John))

Parameters:
attributeName - A valid attribute name
value - A value that, if it exists, will cause the object to be excluded from the result set.

setFilter

public void setFilter(String attributeName,
                      String value)
Set up a standard filter attribute name and value pair.

Example Values

AttributeValue
givenNameJohn

Result

(givenName=John)

Parameters:
attributeName - A valid attribute name
value - A value that, if it exists, will cause the object to be included in result set.

setFilterOr

public void setFilterOr(Map<String,String> nameValuePairs)
Set up an OR filter for each map key and value. Consider the following example.

Example Values

AttributeValue
givenNameJohn
snSmith

Result

(|(givenName=John)(sn=Smith))

Parameters:
nameValuePairs - A valid list of attribute to name pairs

setFilterOr

public void setFilterOr(Properties nameValuePairs)
Convienence wrapper for setFilterOr(java.util.Map)

Parameters:
nameValuePairs - A valid map of name=value pairs.
See Also:
setFilterOr(java.util.Map)
